weapons.name: Pitchfork of the Peasantry
weapons.description: Rusty but reliable. Farmers wield it with surprising fury.

weapons.name: Bronze Age Kopesh
weapons.description: An old-world weapon, still sharp, still deadly.

weapons.name: Blunderbuss of Misfires
weapons.description: Roll a d20: on a 1–3, it backfires and hits you instead.

weapons.name: War Gong
weapons.description: Struck with a mallet, its sound deafens foes for 1 round.

armor.name: Bone Shaman Vest
armor.description: Woven from sacred bones, rattles ominously during battle.

armor.name: Ironwood Shield
armor.description: Carved from enchanted trees; resists most blows but burns easily.

armor.name: Clay Plate Harness
armor.description: Heavy armor made from baked clay tiles. Strong, but shatters on a critical hit.

consumables.name: Rotgrub in a Jar
consumables.effect: throw as weapon: 1d6 ongoing damage unless burned

consumables.name: Pickled Troll Finger
consumables.effect: Heals 1d4 HP, but may regrow hair in strange places.

consumables.name: Black Lotus Smoke
consumables.effect: Grants visions, +2 to spellcasting for 1 hour, then 1d6 poison damage.
consumables.description: Banned in most cities, prized by cults.

consumables.name: Stout of Stonebrew
consumables.effect: +2 AC for 1 hour, but movement halved.
consumables.description: Dwarven ale said to turn one’s skin to granite.

consumables.name: Sizzling Salamander Skewer
consumables.description: Popular street food in desert markets.

accessories.name: Amulet of Forgotten Gods
accessories.effect: +1 Will save, whispers ancient blasphemies at night.
accessories.description: A cracked stone pendant etched with runes of the void.

accessories.name: Sandwalker Anklet
accessories.description: Favored by nomads of the Great Dunes.

accessories.name: Cloak of Vexing Patterns
accessories.effect: Enemies attacking must pass a Will save or be distracted.
accessories.description: The shifting embroidery causes dizziness if stared at too long.

accessories.name: Ring of Questionable Sponsorship
accessories.effect: Once per day, summon a random item from a corporate sponsor.
accessories.description: Inscribed with mysterious brand sigils like ‘Coca-Khaos’.

miscellaneous.name: Idol of the Crawling Chaos
miscellaneous.effect: whispers secrets at night, DC 12 Will save or go mad

miscellaneous.name: Goblin Dice
miscellaneous.effect: roll to gamble, 50% chance they bite

miscellaneous.name: Lantern of Red Smoke
miscellaneous.effect: illuminates but fills room with choking fumes

miscellaneous.name: Book of Infinite Margins
miscellaneous.effect: blank, but new scribbles appear daily

miscellaneous.name: Portable Hole (Leaky)
miscellaneous.effect: stores up to 50 lbs before it seeps out

miscellaneous.name: Goblin Market Token
miscellaneous.effect: Trade for strange goods in hidden markets.
miscellaneous.description: A small brass coin with shifting faces engraved.

miscellaneous.name: Traveling Merchant Bell
miscellaneous.effect: Summons a wandering peddler within 1d4 hours.
miscellaneous.description: Its ring carries across planes and realities.

miscellaneous.name: Fool’s Gold Nugget
miscellaneous.effect: Looks like gold, fools 90% of merchants.

miscellaneous.name: Bone Dice of the Ancestors
miscellaneous.effect: Roll 2d6 once per day; on 7, gain +1 Luck, otherwise nothing happens.
miscellaneous.description: Said to carry the voices of your lineage.

miscellaneous.name: Cultural Mask of the Jade Isles
miscellaneous.effect: Worn during rituals, grants +2 Persuasion with islanders.
miscellaneous.description: Brightly painted, sacred to a distant culture.
